description: Originally from American English, of imitative origin.

examples: Lennon let out a deep, proud burp after downing the beer.

verbs.description: burp (third-person singular simple present burps, present participle burping, simple past and past participle burped)

examples: Burping is considered impolite in most western cultures.
My dad used to burp to hide the fact he was farting.
Stevie intends to burp the alphabet at the school talent show.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause someone (such as a baby) to burp.
(transitive) To open (a container of fermenting substance) to allow the release of accumulated gas.
examples: Ferment the lemons for up to 2 weeks, opening the bag occasionally to burp it and release carbon dioxide, and reseal.
